main event: On May 5, 1949, a highly reflective, oblong-shaped object was observed at an altitude of 10,000 feet over the Waco Firing Range #4 at Fort Bliss, Texas. The object traveled from west to east, covering a distance of 10,000 yards in 30-50 seconds, at speeds of 200-250 mph before fading in the distance.
interesting points: The object was described as a 3-inch disc at arm's length, appearing white in color and highly reflective.
Witnesses included military officers Major [REDACTED] and Captain [REDACTED], who were deemed reliable and of good character.
The observers reported clear weather conditions with a light blue sky and no clouds at the time of sighting.
No sound, odor, or trail was associated with the object, and it did not produce any projections or maneuvers before disappearing in a straight, level course.
Despite the sighting, no photographs of the object or fragments were obtained, and there were no local flight schedules that could explain the object.
sighted object: highly reflective, oblong-shaped object at an altitude of 10,000 feet
location: Waco Firing Range #4, Fort Bliss, Texas
